verbose_text: Although conventional radiography is a common method for detecting small amount of intraperitoneal free air [XREF_BIBR], imagers may not detect pneumoperitoneum or retroperitoneum in up to 49% of patients [XREF_BIBR]; in addition, many patients with acute abdominal pain cannot stand to have a chest radiograph, so decubitus abdominal x-ray is usually used [XREF_BIBR].
